column4: Is there a significant difference between kubuntu and ubuntu with kde installed along with gnome?
So if I am new to linux and wish to try *ubuntu, would you suggest ubuntu and install kde as well or kubuntu?
you just install the kubuntu-desktop package and you get both gnome and kde
: so I should download the kubuntu ios and go from there?
if you download the kubuntu iso, you will only get kde.  If you want to get gnome after that you just install 'ubuntu-desktop' package.  Then you will have both

I think easiest way would be to make a new group and add the group to /etc/sudoers.  There is proper syntax that will allow access only to certain commands (you would just use whatever opens network tools).  I don't know the syntax too well though
: do you know where I can read more about this?
probably some easier to read tutorials on google, but I don';t know of any
: how do I find out what program I need to give access to for network settings?
by the way, when you edit /etc/sudoers, you want to use the 'visudo' command.  It will make sure you don't mess up the syntax and lock yourself out
oh come on, vi is awesome.  But no you don't have to use it.  Just do 'EDITOR=nano sudo visudo', I think that will give you nano
not necessary, just more efficient.  You can just use 'ed' too instead of nano if you want to get more basic
: so I can give them access to sudo that command and they schould have access to change the network settings?
yeah, you just have to look up the syntax.  Make a new group, maybe 'students'.  Then I know you start the line with %students, and workk from there
